awd_titl_txt: U.S.-Taiwan Joint Workshop:  Oceanic Microwave Remote       Sensing Research at the Lewes Campus of the University of   Delaware on August 9-11, 1995
awd_abstract_narration: This is a joint U.S.-Taiwan workshop on oceanic microwave  remote sensing techniques proposed by Dr. Dennis Trizna,  University of Delaware and Professor Jin Wu, National Cheng  Kung University.  The proposed workshop is focused on three  kinds of microwave instruments: altimeter, scatterometer,  and radiometer in oceanic research  application.  The  proposed participants are  specialists  in the microwave  field.  The topic of the workshop is important for both the  U.S. and Taiwan.   The investigators from both countries  stand to benefit from this interaction.  The Taiwan  scientists can become familiar with recent scientific and  technological advances and the U.S. researchers can use this  opportunity to access the new facilities available in  Taiwan.  This workshop is to be held on August 9-11, 1995 at  the Lewes campus of  the University of Delaware.  The  project is jointly supported by the National Science  Foundation and the Taiwan National Science Council.
org_div_long_name: Office of International Science and Engineering

perf_inst.perf_inst_name: University of Delaware College of Marine Studies
